intro: Armeriastrum olivieri, commonly known as the oliveleaf armeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes various species of flowering plants known for their showy inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Armeriastrum olivieri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
